Keywords: X-Factor , X-Men
Real Name: Armando Munoz
Special Powers
HYPER-EVOLUTION: Darwin has SAGEGUARD: Outwit. // Once per turn, when Darwin is targeted by an attack, you may choose a color of a standard power displayed on the attacker's dial. If you do, Darwin can use all standard powers of the chosen color until the end of your next turn. Protected: Pulse Wave.

July 9, 2022
hoojeebo
Black is said to be "the sum of all colors" when a blackish stain is obtained from the mixture of various pigments. And black is said to be the "absence of color" when all light radiation is removed. Inversely, in reference to light, white is "all colors", as proven by prisms and rainbows.

July 7, 2022
Gensan
You can choose any color of a standard power currently displayed on the attacker's dial when Darwin is attacked. If a Black standard power is showing, you could pick Black and Darwin would be able to use Stealth, Steal Energy, Regeneration, and Outwit until the end of your next turn. Note that having Stealth would not prevent him from being targeted by the attack that allowed him to pick the color, since his ability is triggered off of him being targeted in the first place. The same thing if he picks Dark Blue and then can use Shape Change. He has already been targeted by this specific attack, so nothing he gains at this point can prevent it. (I add this because I feel it will come up in the Rules Questions Forum at some point if I don't).
